translations.This user account is disabled, please co: This user account is disabled, please contact your administrator.
translations.Unknown error, please check the log file: Unknown error, please check the log file for more details.
translations.X.509 certificate of the Service Provide: X.509 certificate of the Service Provider
translations.Private key of the Service Provider: Private key of the Service Provider
translations.Indicates that the nameID of the <samlp:: Indicates that the nameID of the <samlp:logoutRequest> sent by this SP will be encrypted.
translations.Indicates whether the <samlp:AuthnReques: Indicates whether the <samlp:AuthnRequest> messages sent by this SP will be signed. [Metadata of the SP will offer this info]
translations.Indicates whether the <samlp:logoutRequ: Indicates whether the  <samlp:logoutRequest> messages sent by this SP will be signed.
translations.Indicates whether the <samlp:logoutResp: Indicates whether the  <samlp:logoutResponse> messages sent by this SP will be signed.
Whether the metadata should be signed.
translations.Indicates a requirement for the <samlp:R: Indicates a requirement for the <samlp:Response>, <samlp:LogoutRequest> and <samlp:LogoutResponse> elements received by this SP to be signed.
translations.Indicates a requirement for the <saml:As: Indicates a requirement for the <saml:Assertion> elements received by this SP to be signed. [Metadata of the SP will offer this info]
Indicates a requirement for the <saml:Assertion> elements received by this SP to be encrypted.
translations.Indicates a requirement for the NameID: Indicates a requirement for the NameID element on the SAMLResponse received by this SP to be present.
translations.Indicates a requirement for the NameID r: Indicates a requirement for the NameID received by this SP to be encrypted.
translations.Indicates if the SP will validate all re: Indicates if the SP will validate all received XML.
translations.ADFS URL-Encodes SAML data as lowercase,: ADFS URL-Encodes SAML data as lowercase, and the toolkit by default uses uppercase. Enable for ADFS compatibility on signature verification.
Attribute to map the UID to.
translations.Only allow authentication if an account: Only allow authentication if an account exists on some other backend. (e.g. LDAP)
Attribute to map the displayname to.
Attribute to map the email address to.
Attribute to map the quota to.
Attribute to map the users groups to.
translations.Use SAML auth for the %s desktop clients: Use SAML auth for the %s desktop clients (requires user re-authentication)
translations.Optional display name of the identity pr: Optional display name of the identity provider (default: "SSO & SAML log in")
translations.Allow the use of multiple user back-ends: Allow the use of multiple user back-ends (e.g. LDAP)
translations.Using the SSO & SAML app of your Nextclo:
Using the SSO & SAML app of your Nextcloud you can make it easily possible to integrate your existing Single-Sign-On solution with Nextcloud. In addition, you can use the Nextcloud LDAP user provider to keep the convenience for users. (e.g. when sharing)
The following providers are supported and tested at the moment:

* **SAML 2.0**
	* OneLogin
	* Shibboleth
	* Active Directory Federation Services (ADFS)

* **Authentication via Environment Variable**
	* Kerberos (mod_auth_kerb)
	* Any other provider that authenticates using the environment variable

While theoretically any other authentication provider implementing either one of those standards is compatible, we like to note that they are not part of any internal test matrix.
translations.Please choose whether you want to authen: Please choose whether you want to authenticate using the SAML provider built-in in Nextcloud or whether you want to authenticate against an environment variable.
translations.If your Service Provider should use cert: If your Service Provider should use certificates you can optionally specify them here.
translations.Identifier of the IdP entity (must be a: Identifier of the IdP entity (must be a URI)
translations.URL Target of the IdP where the SP will: URL Target of the IdP where the SP will send the Authentication Request Message
translations.URL Location of the IdP where the SP wil: URL Location of the IdP where the SP will send the SLO Request
translations.Public X.509 certificate of the IdP: Public X.509 certificate of the IdP
translations.If you want to optionally map attributes: If you want to optionally map attributes to the user you can configure these here.
translations.For increased security we recommend enab: For increased security we recommend enabling the following settings if supported by your environment.
translations.Your account is not provisioned, access: Your account is not provisioned, access to this service is thus not possible.
